name.namePart: assisted by Dr. John Christman, LSU, Baton Rouge, Louisiana.

mods.abstract: The subject matter is that of marine-life forms, a favorite subject and interest of the artist.
mods.note: The isotope used in this print was Sulfur 35. The print was made up of three colors; dark green, brown, and chartreuse. The drawing was made using a brush and scraping. Ms. Durieux stated that a wide needle tool was used to create the curling areas seen in the background.

name.namePart: Louisiana State University (Baton Rouge, La.). Museum of Art

titleInfo.title: Caroline Wogan Durieux Works of Art

location.physicalLocation: LSU Museum of Art, Shaw Center for the Arts, Baton Rouge, LA
